intro: Canthium ealaense, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. Canthium ealaense produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
